source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: Irradiation growth tests at 553 K and a fast neutron flux of about 6.5×10¹⁷ n m⁻² s⁻¹ were performed on specimens of Zr-2.5Nb pressure tubes to a neutron fluence of 3.5×10²⁵ n m⁻²

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: fast neutron flux of about 6.5×10¹⁷ n m⁻² s⁻¹

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: All transverse specimens exhibited similar negative growth behavior

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: longitudinal specimens showed different growth characteristics

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: three-stage growth curve was observed showing an initial offset, a low growth rate regime, and a region of apparent steady-state growth

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: growth specimens (60 by 9.9 by 1.5 mm)

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: final heat treatment of 86.4 ks at 673 K

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: irradiation conditions were 553 K and a fast neutron flux of about 6.5×10¹⁷ n m⁻² s⁻¹

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: Periodic specimen length measurements were made to an accuracy of 0.5 μm

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: Four different samples have been irradiated, with the greatest fluence being $3 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ m } ^ { - 2 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: The early measurements from the longitudinal samples indicate that an initial offset of $2 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$ occurred

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: a period of low or zero growth followed, until a fluence of $\mathbf { 1 } \times \mathbf { 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } } \mathbf { n } \ \mathbf { m ^ { - 2 } }$ was attained

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: for all samples an approximately steady growth rate of $3 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 9 } \ \mathbf { m } ^ { 2 } \mathbf { n } ^ { - 1 }$ was established

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: The results from the transverse samples also indicate an initial offset of $2 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$ ; in this case, however, it is negative

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: Irradiation to higher fluences results in continued contraction of the sample, at an approximately steady rate of $2 . 0 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 9 } \ \mathbf { m } ^ { 2 } \mathbf { n } ^ { - 1 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: The longitudinal samples manufactured from Route 1 material indicated a positive initial offset of $2 . 0 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: continued irradiation resulted in specimen contraction

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: a steady rate of approximately $- 2 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 9 } \mathrm { { \ m } } ^ { 2 } \mathrm { { n } } ^ { - 1 }$ has been established

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: Transverse samples show a negative offset of $1 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: continued contraction at a rate of about $1 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 9 } \ \mathbf { m } ^ { 2 } \mathbf { n } ^ { - 1 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: Steady growth rates of about $3 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 9 } \ \mathbf { m } ^ { 2 } \mathbf { n } ^ { - 1 }$ and $1 . 5 ~ \times$ $\mathbf { \bar { 1 0 } ^ { - 2 9 } \ m ^ { 2 } n ^ { - 1 } }$ have been observed for longitudinal and transverse samples respectively

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: Steady growth rates of about $3 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 9 } \ \mathbf { m } ^ { 2 } \mathbf { n } ^ { - 1 }$ and $1 . 5 ~ \times$ $\mathbf { \bar { 1 0 } ^ { - 2 9 } \ m ^ { 2 } n ^ { - 1 } }$ have been observed for longitudinal and transverse samples respectively

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: The growth measurements of longitudinal samples of Route 3 material indicate an initial offset of 2.5 to $3 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: Continued irradiation has resulted in positive growth at a rate of $1 . 9 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 9 } \mathrm { m } ^ { 2 } \mathrm { n } ^ { - 1 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk3
evidence_span: Results of transverse samples show an initial decrease in length of $2 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: in the modified pressure tube materials the $\beta$ phase is present in different transformed conditions (Table 4) which relate to the post-extrusion heat treatments

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: Observations on current material [9] also indicate that the $\beta$ -phase has been transformed

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: The transformation reactions change the morphology of the grain boundary phase from a continuous structure to a discontinuous structure which consists wholly or partly of discrete particles

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: The interface also changes from being faceted with steps to an irregular morphology

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: Stage 1 is low fluence behavior which at a fluence of $1 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 4 } \mathrm { n m } ^ { - 2 }$ appears as a strain offset

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: the offset is equal in magnitude but opposite in sign for longitudinal and transverse specimens

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: Stage 2 is a transient stage, the form of which depends on the interaction of irradiationproduced point defects with the microstructure of the material

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: Stage 3 is a region of approximately steady-state deformation, the onset of which is dependent on microstructure and irradiation temperature

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: true steady state may not occur until fluences of about $1 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 6 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ m ~ } ^ { - 2 }$ or higher are reached

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: For the range of fluence in the current study Route 1 and Route 3 are considered not to have reached Stage 3 behavior

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: transverse specimens exhibit only Stage 1 and Stage 3 behavior

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: Changes in the distribution of pre-irradiated residual stresses appear to saturate at fluences of $< 1 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 4 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ m ~ } ^ { - 2 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: the materials are often referred to as being stress free following the final heat treatment at $\mathbf { 6 7 3 \ K }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: at the irradiation temperature of $\$ 53\ 8$ some effective strain offset would be expected due to redistribution of the internal stress at this lower temperature

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: For the longitudinal samples, the offset measured at a fluence of approximately $1 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 4 } \mathrm { n }$ $\mathbf { m } ^ { - 2 }$ was about $2 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: for transverse specimens it was about $- 2 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 }$

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: The magnitude of the offset strain at this fluence does not appear to be strongly dependent on the initial microstructure

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk4
evidence_span: Widely different strain transients in longitudinal specimens at fluences $> 1 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 4 } \mathrm { ~ n ~ m ~ } ^ { - 2 }$ have been observed

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: After a certain fluence, about $1 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \mathrm { n } \mathrm { m } ^ { - 2 }$ , for Route 2 and current material, a significant increase in growth rate is observed

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: For Route 1 and Route 3 materials, Stage 3 is expected to occur at higher fluences than achieved in the present study

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: In Route 1 material a reversal of the Stage 2 shrinkage is expected in accordance with other studies in Zr-2.5Nb at higher temperatures [14]

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: For Route 3 material the onset of Stage 3 is expected to result in an increased growth rate

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: Route 1 and Route 2 material exhibit similar rates of shrinkage which are about three quarters of the rate of Route 3 and current material

evidence_span: mechanical characteristics of the zirconium alloys approached a limit value as early as 5×10²⁴ n m⁻²

evidence_span: β quenched Zircaloy-4 for which the limit value was reached later at about 5×10²⁵ n m⁻²

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: Uniform elongation at 588 K showed a minimum at about 5×10²⁴ n m⁻²

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: stress-relieved Zircaloy-4 presented the most marked tendency to increase

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: Longitudinal direction growth of annealed Zircaloy-4 and longitudinal and transverse direction growth of stress-relieved Zircaloy-4 may be expressed by the formula ε = A(φt)ⁿ where n=0.67 (stress-relieved Zircaloy-4) and n=0.4 (annealed Zircaloy-4)

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: Longitudinal direction growth of annealed Zircaloy-4 and longitudinal and transverse direction growth of stress-relieved Zircaloy-4 may be expressed by the formula ε = A(φt)ⁿ where n=0.67 (stress-relieved Zircaloy-4) and n=0.4 (annealed Zircaloy-4)

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: stress-relaxation of the zirconium base materials is nearly complete for 4×10²⁵ n m⁻²

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: Zr-1Nb which has an intermediate behavior between those of Zircaloy-4 and Inconel 718

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: load exerted by the springs of Zircaloy-4 prototype cells is completely relaxed beyond 2×10²⁵ n m⁻²

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: residual load after irradiation at about 5×10²⁵ n m⁻² is comparable to that observed for an Inconel 718 manufactured cell
